alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 19 at 3:32AM PST until January 19 at 11:23PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River will continue to slowly recede today. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PST Thursday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM PST Thursday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to slowly recede. It will fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.7 feet on 01/04/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 315 PM PST.
